intro: Lindernia lindernioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and dry environments, exhibiting drought tolerance. It produces showy, often pink or purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lindernia lindernioides is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
